author: JanFSchulte
body:
This PR adresses issue https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/issues/37290 and removes duplicate code from `HLTriggerOffline/Muon`, where the propagation of muon tracks from the IP to the muon system and their matching to L1 muons was re-implemented for use in offline DQM (classes `PropagateToMuon` and `L1MuonMatcherAlgo`). The code providing the same functionality from `MuonAnalysis/MuonAssociators` is used instead. 

Because `HLTMuonValidtor` creates `HLTMuonPlotter` objects, which in turn consume ESTokens, outside it's constructor (see https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/blob/master/HLTriggerOffline/Muon/src/HLTMuonValidator.cc#L165), these token have to be fed down the chain of constructors. The machinery for this was added to the implementation of the propagation and matching code in `HLTriggerOffline/Muon` and has now been integrated into the one in  `MuonAnalysis/MuonAssociators` so that all applications of this code can use the same implementation. 

#### PR validation:

No changes in results expected. Code passes all unit tests (even though I think the packages in question might not have any) and all tests run with `runTheMatrix.py -l limited -i all --ibeos` path without failure.
title: Clean duplicate code in HLTriggerOffline/Muon
